parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Molnár András, although it doesn't explicitly name him as a candidate. However, the context strongly suggests he is running for office, given the call to vote for him on December 1st and the mention of representing the Hungarian minority.  This aligns with "Article 36 (7) - a" if he is indeed a candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The use of both Romanian and Hungarian languages further broadens its potential reach. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Molnár András in the upcoming election. The phrases "Vasárnap támogassanak minket szavazatukkal" (Sunday support us with your vote) and "Duminică sprijiniți-ne cu votul dumneavoastră" (Sunday support us with your vote) clearly aim to influence voting behavior. This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it directly advocates for a specific candidate, lacking the neutrality expected in journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content transcends personal opinion. While it expresses a viewpoint, its core purpose is not merely to share an opinion but to actively solicit votes for a particular candidate. The call to action is too direct to be considered a mere expression of personal belief.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>907338324823558</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, a paid Facebook advertisement by Trendmakers, promotes Molnár András, strongly implying he is a candidate in the upcoming December 1st election. The call to vote for him, coupled with the advertisement's broad reach and lack of journalistic neutrality, strongly suggests it constitutes electoral propaganda.  While it lacks a CMF number, the context makes it highly probable that this is a violation. The post's bilingual nature (Romanian and Hungarian) indicates an attempt to reach a specific demographic within the electorate. The spending of RON 400-499 further emphasizes the intention to influence voters.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Molnár András</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Trendmakers</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Trendmakers, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 907338324823558), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatul Molnár András prin îndemnuri directe la vot ("Vasárnap támogassanak minket szavazatukkal", "Duminică sprijiniți-ne cu votul dumneavoastră"), având un efect electoral clar prin influențarea votanților în favoarea acestuia. Reclama, cu o cheltuială de RON 400-499,  se adresează publicului larg, utilizând atât limba română, cât și limba maghiară, și nu respectă standardele jurnalismului obiectiv, constituind astfel material de propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Contact: office@trendmakers.ro, +40744612046.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
